document.title: College and Career Readiness Standards for Adult Education

661A8E69530B473190FF1EEDF2FE9807.description: Acquire and use accurately level-appropriate general academic and domain-specific words and phrases; gather vocabulary knowledge when considering a word or phrase important to comprehension or expression.

63EE75F783A248E2B11AD64C8990199C.description:
CCR Anchor 6: Acquire and use accurately a range of general academic and domain-specific words and phrases sufficient for reading, writing, speaking, and listening at the college and career readiness level; demonstrate independence in gathering vocabulary knowledge when encountering a word or phrase important
to comprehension or expression.

ECEA4A4EE9B94894BCE61415541278FF.description: CCR Anchor 5: Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and nuances in word meanings.

010EF1D4676F4C3E9862F366E20F3331.description: Verify the preliminary determination of the meaning of a word or phrase (e.g., by checking the inferred meaning in context or in a dictionary).

7BF09B2BBA934B5BBEF5FA5BA4587B93.description:
Consult reference materials (e.g., dictionaries,
glossaries, thesauruses), both print and digital, to find the pronunciation of a word or determine or clarify its precise meaning or its part of speech.

67A6AF35E5B244C6AB1E04FEFB12A98C.description: Use common, grade- appropriate Greek or Latin affixes and roots as clues to the meaning of a word (e.g., audience, auditory, audible).

D11777DD527047E4AE66492160CB6C39.description: Use context (e.g., the overall meaning of a sentence or paragraph; a word’s position or function in a sentence) as a clue to the meaning of a word or phrase.

FE9EFF0324F34A20A259E659B63EAA70.description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases, choosing flexibly from a range of strategies.

B30FEA50CB7E43AC82CBBE1CE9A3662A.description:
CCR Anchor 4: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases by using context clues, analyzing meaningful word parts,
 
 
and consulting general and specialized reference materials, as appropriate.

9FA46DF4F5384AF2B3FDDDB0891D4B63.description: Choose language that expresses ideas precisely and concisely, recognizing and eliminating wordiness and redundancy.

4254DA54AC28460EADD65B054C2604A5.description: Maintain consistency in style and tone.

E802CD48F6184B7A9D4860F7CE0FC754.description: Vary sentence patterns for meaning, reader/listener interest, and style.

7C5DA9F716B943A0AD2151D190500CDC.description: Use knowledge of language and its conventions when writing, speaking, reading, or listening.

EAE55456BEBE4D20838DC518B787794F.description: CCR Anchor 3: Apply knowledge of language to understand how language functions in different contexts, to make effective choices for meaning or style, and to comprehend more fully when reading or listening.

2EBD4B07F93D4741BB3D199F601F0DAD.description: Use an ellipsis to indicate an omission.

EDCE40C2A2F644BBB0EC2DF3F0E71BBC.description: Use a comma to separate coordinate adjectives (e.g., It was a fascinating, enjoyable movie but not He wore an old[,] green shirt).

BD6667AE5C2A4E2C8F444BD05CD5756D.description: Use punctuation (commas, parentheses, ellipsis, dashes) to set off nonrestrictive/parenthetical elements.

B79A579347D64ABA8DA7708D0418AA3B.description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling when writing.

7917FAAFF0374802A7BBF6A16F33F613.description: CCR Anchor 2: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling when writing.

44ED7771EDF94FC5B42FEA36EA6EB6C6.description: Place phrases and clauses within a sentence, recognizing and correcting misplaced and dangling modifiers.

3066068AF96C457DBA9F1265DCC2BF90.description: Choose among simple, compound, complex, and compound-complex sentences to signal differing relationships among ideas.

9B37DA40045E413DB7BEB0F9F6FD3A98.description: Explain the function of phrases and clauses in general and their function in specific sentences.

40860AEAC81C4C3E80BE9D417E0C1CDB.description: Recognize and correct inappropriate shifts in verb voice and mood.

B4161426AB5E423685D4A0F9BD0B864B.description: Form and use verbs in the indicative, imperative, interrogative, conditional, and subjunctive mood.

A0BD44906AB247EE9051DE55D8C63D28.description: Form and use verbs in the active and passive voice.

473B5174928A458B955F255129805420.description: Explain the function of verbals (gerunds, participles, infinitives) in general and their function in particular sentences.

B24A46E8AFD74E2EA32CB7F8076082C0.description: Recognize variations from standard English in their own and others’ writing and speaking, and identify and use strategies to improve expression in conventional language.

DD4ECB743E8E44569213673C92AAC7F6.description: Recognize and correct vague or unclear pronouns.

017CCC4CC6864C429DB7F403882B32C0.description: Recognize and correct inappropriate shifts in pronoun number and person.

7F6C304FE60B4B9A97FDAC0B0CEF4454.description: Ensure that pronouns are in the proper case (subjective, objective, possessive).

AE427DAFCCB64163B52803F77B0BAC8D.description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking.

EDE10C71CAF5485D8092EA0D61148121.description: CCR Anchor 1: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking.

C0FE020D58A64194B1D4FEBE2F8BF1D6.description: Adapt speech to a variety of contexts and tasks, demonstrating command of formal English when indicated or appropriate.

C319BA82264D4B5B85F71D0F4DB6CB34.description: CCR Anchor 6: Adapt speech to a variety of contexts and communicative tasks, demonstrating command of formal English when indicated or appropriate.

6843AE0252264937B15A35B759810062.description: Integrate multimedia and visual displays into presentations to clarify information, strengthen claims and evidence, and add interest.

665E14DA79E74D5E93F65F0A6E7E4557.description: CCR Anchor 5: Make strategic use of digital media and visual displays of data to express information and enhance understanding of presentations.

48295ECDA733418E9D827CF22C599698.description: Present claims and findings, emphasizing salient points in a focused, coherent manner with relevant evidence, sound valid reasoning, and well-chosen details; use appropriate eye contact, adequate volume, and clear pronunciation.

2C3DD00293144639A376B5C1927418CA.description: CCR Anchor 4: Present information, findings, and supporting evidence such that listeners can follow the line of reasoning and the organization, development, and style are appropriate to task, purpose, and audience.

22FADD9B06EA412E818BA726C4C285A2.description: Delineate a speaker’s argument and specific claims, evaluating the soundness of the reasoning and relevance and sufficiency of the evidence and identifying when irrelevant evidence is introduced.

082E48942A5E44E589D612ACB9682554.description: CCR Anchor 3: Evaluate a speaker’s point of view, reasoning, and use of evidence and rhetoric.

6A798805C2A24520B8BDE0B2EE8F1E94.description: Analyze the purpose of information presented in diverse media and formats (e.g., visually, quantitatively, orally) and evaluate the motives (e.g., social, commercial, political) behind its presentation.

6F7D082DC6AB42F6880E71DAD5FFA6BC.description: CCR Anchor 2: Integrate and evaluate information presented in diverse media and formats, including visually, quantitatively, and orally.

E900FA8F7C9546B0B4910E0B6D1843E4.description: Acknowledge new information expressed by others, and, when warranted, qualify or justify their own views in light of the evidence presented.

B5719652BF274CC88AB2557B3A3389D4.description: Pose questions that connect the ideas of several speakers and respond to others’ questions and comments with relevant evidence, observations, and ideas.

DC714FB65E3A490AA1DB367032277A2D.description: Follow rules for collegial discussions and decision- making, track progress toward specific goals and deadlines, and define individual roles as needed.

B638C9A316134B1F9377561ECF39A1E8.description: Come to discussions prepared, having read or researched material under study; explicitly draw on that preparation by referring to evidence on the topic, text, or issue to probe and reflect on ideas under discussion.

8C488B58902F4532BABB7EE919D3AF6B.description: Engage effectively in a range of collaborative discussions (one- on-one, in groups, and teacher- led) with diverse partners, building on others’ ideas and expressing their own clearly.

5FCA58F203AA49EDA885D06DBF3A3A6C.description: CCR Anchor 1: Prepare for and participate effectively in a range of conversations and collaborations with diverse partners, building on others’ ideas and expressing their own clearly and persuasively.

49E0C9B7CE5F4D35B444724DE0C21FE6.description: Apply Reading standards from this level to literary nonfiction (e.g., “Analyze how a text makes connections among and distinctions between individuals’ ideas or events”).

67D1CF84CB8A4158809EA919E7ACED65.description: Apply Reading standards from this level to literature (e.g., “Determine a theme or central idea of a text and how it is conveyed through particular details; provide a summary of the text distinct from personal opinions or judgments”).

D4B6808BEF554398B7C9743B42861CA1.description: Draw evidence from literary or informational texts to support analysis, reflection, and research.

6CB869D64E1E484395182D62FF6FCA09.description: CCR Anchor 9: Draw evidence from literary or informational texts to support analysis, reflection, and research.

5D064E88089946B8A1893E64BADCACE9.description: Gather relevant information from multiple print and digital sources, using search terms effectively; assess the credibility and accuracy of each source; and quote or paraphrase the data and conclusions of others while avoiding plagiarism and following a standard format for citation.

40D6C06DCE314659AD68740576012AA0.description: CCR Anchor 8: Gather relevant information from multiple print and digital sources, assess the credibility and accuracy of each source, and integrate the information while avoiding plagiarism.

8D46E22DB7A4499192F1E3972DF6356D.description: Conduct short research projects to answer a question, drawing on several sources and generating additional related, focused questions for further research and investigation.

AD50F23B043C48CA8AD5E933BD827178.description: CCR Anchor 7: Conduct short as well as more sustained research projects based on focused questions, demonstrating understanding of the subject under investigation.

1AD2B4B53F2644E9A7C07DC78BBF7D33.description: Use technology, including the Internet, to produce and publish writing and link to and cite sources as well as to interact and collaborate with others, including linking to and citing sources.

AC4552EFB5E74C2DBB37B07F2B507D0F.description: CCR Anchor 6: Use technology, including the Internet, to produce and publish writing and to interact and collaborate with others.

8D92162CE05F4862B6D1CD8236209AD5.description: With some guidance and support from peers and others, develop and strengthen writing as needed by planning, revising, editing, rewriting, or trying a new approach, focusing on how well purpose and audience have been addressed. (Editing for conventions should demonstrate command of Language standards 1–3 at this level.)

5DD2B89C03C54F0FB82C79D2F76154BC.description: CCR Anchor 5: Develop and strengthen writing as needed by planning, revising, editing, rewriting, or trying a new approach.

B9535C6B47D94513A69FBB571B206254.description: Produce clear and coherent writing in which the development, organization, and style are appropriate to task, purpose, and audience.

942E764E2A574C22A21A30D689ACE9B4.description: CCR Anchor 4: Produce clear and coherent writing in which the development, organization, and style are appropriate to task, purpose, and audience.

FE3FF90FC5184781A9CC2BAB8906E949.description: Note: Students’ narrative skills continue to grow in these levels as students work to incorporate narrative elements effectively into their arguments and informative/explanatory texts.

64196F2EABDC4A8BB2C5C5D5FC0F5B1E.description:
CCR Anchor 3: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, well-chosen details and well-structured event
 
 
sequences.

E67825FF8BA5412EA2C7D9656D8406CE.description: Provide a concluding statement or section that follows from and supports the information or explanation presented.

6DC84AF73A9C45928809F2C274D4976F.description: Establish and maintain a formal style.

AB45D0B31DA14F229F4C57ADD5A715F6.description: Use precise language and domain-specific vocabulary to inform about or explain the topic.

E1B8432D073541BF8E16015EC38CBCFE.description: Use appropriate transitions to create cohesion and clarify the relationships among ideas and concepts.

CD785BD50D3E4F5F97AD4DEC3616F20B.description: Develop the topic with relevant facts, definitions, concrete details, quotations, or other information and examples.

172AFDFF7EF44E3B96F70B6A4E16E099.description: Introduce a topic clearly, previewing what is to follow; organize ideas, concepts, and information, using strategies such as definition, classification, comparison/contrast, and cause/effect; include formatting (e.g., headings), graphics (e.g., charts, tables), and multimedia when useful to aiding comprehension.

B394F2DEF48B401E9736B5FFF6859753.description: Write informative/explanatory texts to examine a topic and convey ideas, concepts, and information through the selection, organization, and analysis of relevant content. [This includes the narration of historical events, scientific procedures/experiments, or technical processes.]

E693C2C9195C47D4BF38E483B87CC2F4.description:
CCR Anchor 2: Write informative/explanatory texts to examine and convey complex ideas and information clearly and accurately through the effective selection,
 
 
organization, and analysis of content.

06582884550B404E89C3E96611D32844.description: Provide a concluding statement or section that follows from and supports the argument presented.

5C7A24C1B7144C2ABD216F44513C21DD.description: Establish and maintain a formal style.

BE3A84C0FC3644F0A5233F0C023C17A8.description: Use words, phrases, and clauses to create cohesion and clarify the relationships among claim(s), reasons, and evidence.

3154F352DDD64D23A609357C225AF5EE.description: Support claim(s) with logical reasoning and relevant evidence, using accurate, credible sources and demonstrating an understanding of the topic or text.

0B49CC88BEB94B95BFD90FC156EA81F6.description: Introduce claim(s), acknowledge alternate or opposing claims, and organize the reasons and evidence logically.

55BBFB172B6B4B3E8A710C89642FD90B.description: Write arguments to support claims with clear reasons and relevant evidence.

F039782CF36E4048BAB443C71D04B506.description: CCR Anchor 1: Write arguments to support claims in an analysis of substantive topics or texts, using valid reasoning and relevant and sufficient evidence.

10A5A159F99842DABE6F959736726412.description: CCR Anchor 10: Read and comprehend complex literary and informational texts independently and proficiently.

B9E1AA462FE24886806945FD3D0D7778.description: Analyze a case in which two or more texts provide conflicting information on the same topic and identify where the texts disagree on matters of fact or interpretation.

FA24E7D76F634E40BC7C68CA2575C6FE.description: CCR Anchor 9: Analyze how two or more texts address similar themes or topics in order to build knowledge or to compare the approaches the authors take.

561E30DFF039400FA979929A5D219BC5.description: Delineate and evaluate the argument and specific claims in a text, assessing whether the reasoning is sound and the evidence is relevant and sufficient; recognize when irrelevant evidence is introduced.

E81490A131B54BB6AA10562B06932538.description:
CCR Anchor 8: Delineate and evaluate the argument and specific claims in a text, including the validity of the reasoning as well as the relevance and sufficiency of
  
the evidence.

A0FD066AC4A64FD8B3A98428D8C2BFE3.description: Integrate quantitative or technical information expressed in words in a text with a version of that information expressed visually (e.g., in a flowchart, diagram, model, graph, or table).

567798849CCF4655948510DB0C2CEE83.description: Integrate information presented in different media or formats (e.g., in charts, graphs, photographs, videos, or maps) as well as in words to develop a coherent understanding of a topic or issue.

9400704AE21E4743BCBEA686F3914E80.description: CCR Anchor 7: Integrate and evaluate content presented in diverse media and formats, including visually and quantitatively, as well as in words.

A4C56A37A5A1414AAFFB082834F657AF.description: Identify aspects of a text that reveal an author’s point of view or purpose (e.g., loaded language, inclusion or avoidance of particular facts).

582E5ED9753B457F8E8B0F7FE0AE7FF6.description: Determine an author’s point of view or purpose in a text and analyze how the author acknowledges and responds to conflicting evidence or viewpoints.

C527D5F4D47C4D18B4488FF6748593B6.description: CCR Anchor 6: Assess how point of view or purpose shapes the content and style of a text.

B1DBC07846BF4EDE898A2943BC74D3DA.description: Analyze the structure an author uses to organize a text, including how the major sections contribute to the whole and to the development of the ideas.

4219403E2C9C454ABE2916330C3017AC.description: Analyze how a particular sentence, paragraph, chapter, or section fits into the overall structure of a text and contributes to the development of the ideas.

7B958D4F4C2D42898C26CC9DE0D62243.description: CCR Anchor 5: Analyze the structure of texts, including how specific sentences, paragraphs, and larger portions of the text (e.g., a section, chapter, scene, or stanza) relate to each other and the whole.

596CA11A29FC4D2EBD6A81D56AEF326F.description: Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text, including figurative, connotative, and technical meanings; analyze the impact of a specific word choice on meaning and tone.

F4E130836F164468BEAA0F72F778C389.description: CCR Anchor 4: Interpret words and phrases as they are used in a text, including determining technical, connotative, and figurative meanings, and analyze how specific word choices shape meaning or tone.

9E0B35170DD844189E1C78A12FF6ACFE.description: Follow precisely a multistep procedure when carrying out experiments, taking measurements, or performing technical tasks.

F0DE94065A274918A0BD3B64872C4A80.description: Application: identify key steps in a text’s description of a process related to history/social studies (e.g., how a bill becomes law, how interest rates are raised or lowered).

E0788583C64449B5A39C72A103A9026C.description: Analyze how a text makes connections among and distinctions between individuals, ideas, or events (e.g., through comparisons, analogies, or categories).

D44A01ACB5234106B692E4A82737EC94.description: CCR Anchor 3: Analyze how and why individuals, events, and ideas develop and interact over the course of a text.

F137E4A5090B4CDE8B945FF63FB753C0.description: Application: determine the central ideas or conclusions of a text; provide an accurate summary of the text distinct from prior knowledge or opinions.

C449D1217FB34CFAB729BCE2BC43E151.description: Determine a theme or central idea of a text and how it is conveyed through particular details; provide a summary of the text distinct from personal opinions or judgments.

CD9151B001DF4F6392601176E0AA3989.description: CCR Anchor 2: Determine central ideas or themes of a text and analyze their development; summarize the key supporting details and ideas.

9BCE2EAD4057418C9F52F9E1EDE28F4A.description: Application: cite specific textual evidence to support analysis of science and technical texts.

7117CFD588404F82A47F66279298942C.description: Application: cite specific textual evidence to support analysis of primary and secondary sources.

39E49827032B4121A77C69B63829CFE0.description: Cite several pieces of textual evidence to support analysis of what the text says explicitly as well as inferences drawn from the text.

202B2C4D27044DF8B5D2BE984E02AC20.description: CCR Anchor 1: Read closely to determine what the text says explicitly and to make logical inferences from it; cite specific textual evidence when writing or speaking to support conclusions drawn from the text.
